â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya November 3, 2023

I woke up today, determined to call her. But it was too early. What if she was asleep? What if she was busy? I told myself to wait. Just a little longer. Just a few more hours. So, I skipped college. Sat there. Thinking. Overthinking. What if somethingâ€™s wrong? What if she actually needs to talk? But she never shares anything like that with me. She never tells me when sheâ€™s sad. So maybe Iâ€™m just making things up in my head again.

At 9 AM, I picked up my phone. My fingers hovered over the call button. Then I stopped. What if sheâ€™s in college? She wonâ€™t pick up. Sheâ€™ll see my call and ignore it. Maybe I should wait. Maybe I should call later.

Wrong.

She didnâ€™t pick up.

The phone rang. And rang. And rang. Then silence.

I stared at my screen, my chest heavy. What the hell? What was the point of messaging me if she was just going to ignore me? What changed? Why now? My mind started spinning, trying to piece together something that made sense. Maybe sheâ€™s busy. Maybe she didnâ€™t see it. Maybe sheâ€™ll call back.

But then.

First, I felt relief. Sheâ€™s okay. Thereâ€™s no trouble. Nothingâ€™s wrong. Thatâ€™s good, right?

But then, the real sadness hit.

She saw my call. She saw my message. And she ignored it.
